Issue Description: Users are reporting that the API key generation process in the developer portal fails with a generic error message about 15% of the time, requiring multiple retries.
Deactivating an API key can take up to 10 minutes to propagate across all services, leaving a window of vulnerability.

Issue Title: New API Keys Inherit Incorrect Permissions
Issue Description: Newly generated API keys are inheriting permissions from a default template, overriding the specific permissions chosen during creation.

Issue Title: Insecure Default Permissions for New API Keys
Issue Description: Newly generated API keys are given overly broad default permissions (e.g., full read/write access), posing a security risk if not immediately restricted.

Issue Title: API Key Audit Log Lacks Detail
Issue Description: The audit log for API key activities does not capture sufficient detail, such as who modified permissions or when an API key was used.

Issue Title: API Key Scope Updates Not Instant
Issue Description: Changes to API key permissions or scopes do not take effect immediately, leading to a delay in policy enforcement.
Developers require more granular control over API key permissions (e.g., read-only access to specific sub-resources).

Issue Title: Automated API Key Rotation Fails Randomly
Issue Description: The scheduled automated API key rotation process fails without notification for certain API keys about 5% of the time.
Users with "admin" roles are unable to delete API keys created by other users within the same organization.

Issue Title: API Key Naming Convention Not Enforced
Issue Description: There is no mechanism to enforce a consistent naming convention for API keys, leading to disorganized keys in large teams.
The Python SDK crashes on initialization when certain environment variables are set, specifically impacting containerized environments.

Issue Title: Python SDK Pagination Issue with Large Datasets
Issue Description: The Python SDK's pagination logic fails to retrieve all records when dealing with datasets exceeding 10,000 entries.
Installing the Python SDK introduces conflicts with common data science libraries, causing dependency resolution issues for users.

Issue Title: Python SDK Asynchronous Client Not Idiomatic
Issue Description: The design of the Python SDK's asynchronous client is not idiomatic to modern Python async patterns, making it difficult to use.

Issue Title: Python SDK Connection Timeout Not Configurable
Issue Description: The Python SDK does not expose any configuration options for setting HTTP connection timeouts.
The Python SDK's automatic retry mechanism for transient network errors is not correctly configured.
Benchmarks show a significant performance regression in the Python SDK for concurrent API calls compared to previous versions.
Some webhook consumers are unable to verify the signature of incoming payloads, indicating a potential inconsistency in the signing process.
Some webhook subscribers are occasionally receiving duplicate event notifications for the same transaction, requiring deduplication logic on their end.
The webhook retry mechanism does not implement an exponential backoff strategy, leading to rapid re-attempts that overload failing endpoints.
The default webhook retry policy is too short (only 3 retries over 5 minutes), leading to missed events during brief outages of consumer services.

Issue Title: Webhook Test Tool Fails to Deliver
Issue Description: The "Send Test Webhook" feature in the developer portal consistently fails to deliver test events to configured endpoints.
The maximum size limit for webhook payloads is not documented, leading to unexpected rejection of large events.
Auth tokens are expiring after 30 minutes despite being configured for 1 hour, causing unexpected logouts and API call failures.

Issue Title: OAuth2 Redirect URI Validation Too Strict
Issue Description: The OAuth2 authorization server is rejecting valid redirect URIs that include query parameters, preventing successful authentication flows.
A vulnerability exists where an expired OAuth refresh token can be reused under specific race conditions to obtain a new access token.

Issue Title: OAuth Device Code Flow Device Linking Failure
Issue Description: The OAuth Device Code flow intermittently fails to link the user's device after successful authorization on another device.

Issue Title: OpenID Connect UserInfo Endpoint Returns Incomplete Data
Issue Description: The OpenID Connect UserInfo endpoint is returning only a subset of the expected user profile attributes.

Issue Title: Inconsistent Error Codes for Payment API
Issue Description: The payment API returns varying error codes for the same type of failure (e.g., card declined), making automated error handling difficult.
The payment capture API is not fully idempotent, leading to occasional double charges if retries occur too quickly.

Issue Title: Payment Reconciliation API Slow for Large Batches
Issue Description: The payment reconciliation API takes an excessively long time to process large daily transaction batches.
The API for managing recurring subscriptions is frequently returning transient errors, impacting customer billing.
Developers require clarification on the exact headers used for rate limiting and how to interpret them, as current documentation is vague.
Different API endpoints return error messages in inconsistent formats (JSON, plain text, XML), making unified error handling difficult.
A significant and sustained increase in API response times (avg 500ms to 2000ms) has been observed across all endpoints for the last 24 hours.

Issue Title: MFA Bypass on Developer Account Login
Issue Description: A security vulnerability allows multi-factor authentication to be bypassed on developer portal logins by manipulating session cookies.

Issue Title: Stored XSS Vulnerability in Developer Portal
Issue Description: A stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability has been discovered in the developer portal's project description field.
A flaw in the developer portal's password reset mechanism allows an attacker to reset any user's password without proper authorization.
The single sign-on (SSO) integration with the SSO provider for the developer portal is consistently failing, preventing enterprise users from logging in.

Issue Title: Developer Portal Weak Account Lockout Policy
Issue Description: The developer portal's account lockout policy is too weak, allowing brute-force password guessing attacks.
A broken access control vulnerability in the developer portal allows users to view or modify projects belonging to other accounts.
The published API specification file for the API is significantly out of date with the current API endpoints and schemas.

Issue Title: API Versioning Strategy Unclear for Deprecations
Issue Description: Developers are confused about the deprecation schedule and how to safely migrate between different API versions.

Issue Title: Missing Node.js SDK Setup Guide for Express
Issue Description: There is no dedicated guide for integrating the Node.js SDK with common frameworks like Express.js, making setup more complex.

Issue Title: TypeScript SDK Type Definitions Out of Sync
Issue Description: The TypeScript SDK's type definitions are not in sync with the latest API response structures, causing compilation errors.
The Java SDK handles date formats inconsistently when serializing/deserializing date fields, causing parsing issues on the client side.

Issue Title: C# SDK Serialization of Enum Types
Issue Description: The C# SDK incorrectly serializes enum types to integers instead of their string representations, causing API request failures.

Issue Title: Missing Mobile SDK UI Framework Guide
Issue Description: A dedicated guide for integrating the mobile SDK with modern declarative UI frameworks is currently missing.

Issue Title: Rust SDK Panics on Malformed JSON Input
Issue Description: The Rust SDK panics and crashes when receiving malformed JSON in an API response instead of returning a proper error.
The PHP SDK documentation refers to a PHP version that is end-of-life and not supported by many modern development environments.
